intro: [WRONG START] Astilea nervosa, commonly known as the silver fern, is a striking plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its feathery, silver-green leaves that resemble a fern. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Its unique appearance makes it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Astelia nervosa is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
